newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai puts preliminary 1st rice forecast 17.76M T.
newsitem.headline: Thai puts preliminary 1st rice forecast 17.76M T.

text.p: Thailand's agriculture ministry has revised up its 1996/97 first crop rice output forecast to 17.76 million tonnes from 17.60 million tonnes previously, a ministry official said on Thursday.
But the figure is preliminary and was yet to be released officially, said Monthol Chiamchareon, head of the ministry's forecast division. He said official revision should be released in December.
"The latest review indicated that the flood damage on rice is not that bad," he told Reuters.
But the ministry is likely to keep soybean and corn output unchanged at 352,600 tonnes and 4.38 million tonnes respectively, Monthol said.
Normally, the agriculture ministry revises its crop forecast every other month. The previous one was supposed to be released in September but floods delayed the forecast to October.
